section.name: Description
section.p: This goal generates an OSGi jar out of a thirdparty library. This way the jar does not have to be included in another bundle and exported.
By merging the existing META-INF/MANIFEST with an Export-Package and Import-Package the jar file is backward compatible and also an OSGi bundle.
The original jar file will be changed this way. To keep the original jar file unchanged set the suffix property.

Example: Replaces the antenna-0.9.2.jar located in the current directory with the corresponding OSGi jar: $ ls -l -rw-r--r-- 1 muellerr users 58324 Jul 18 17:08 antenna-0.9.12.jar
$ maven osgi:thirdparty-jar -DgroupId=j2me -DartifactId=antenna -Dversion=0.9.12
$ ls -l -rw-r--r-- 1 muellerr users 59142 Jul 18 17:10 antenna-0.9.12.jar

With this deploy goal a thirdparty can be directly generated from any directory to the specified .maven/repository artifact directory. Quite usefule when you have downloaded a thirdparty library and you want to make an OSGi bundle out of it and placed in the maven repository.
The parameters are the same as for the thirdparty-jar.

tr.td: Setting this property allows the generation of specification-version information in the Export- Package. Not yet for Import-Package.
Specify the the jar file, you should be located in the same directory.
Per default, the original .jar file will be replaced with the changed manifest. By setting the suffix a new file-suffix.jar is generated and the original is unchanged.
Per default, the attributes are set to export,import. There may cases where we don't want to have the import for example when we are sure that package will never be used.
